title: How to keep ONLY a default Firefox profile for each server user
content: Hi, there is a remote desktop server (aka. terminal), where many various users logs in an uses various applications, including Firefox. Each user has Firefox profiles generated in C:\Users\[USER_NAME]\AppData\Local\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles , but only one profile is a default profile for each individual user. I have two main questions, related to the profiles: 1) in which circumstances a new profile is generated? I see, some users have 3 profile directories, some 5 profile directories. Of course, one profile directory (of a few existing) is a default one. 2) is there any setting in Firefox configuration/FF ADMX Policy/anywhere else, which can help to leave only a default Firefox profile and remove old unused profiles automatically? I know, that it's possible to do that manually by running firefox.exe -p , removing unused profiles and leaving only a default one, but that is not an option. Solution should be automated.
creator: baubas100

title: parole storpiate
content: Gentili tutt*, da qualche tempo alcuni siti si leggono male o non presentano delle funzionalità (Alice Onlus e Virgilio, ad esempio). I termini, le parole e le frasi sono storpiate o modificate (v. le schermate allegate di Alice, in un confronto tra quello che leggo su Firefox e quello che leggo su EDGE). Sul sito di Virgilio ci sono sia le storpiature delle frasi e dei titoli delle cartelle di posta, che la mancanza delle icone di funzionalità (esempio: per uscire dal sito oppure i menù a tendina delle cartelle della posta non si aprono). Ho disattivato le quattro estensioni in uso, ma senza miglioramenti. Grazie per l'attenzione, e un saluto cordiale. Keller Giovanni
creator: g.edokeller

title: Proxy reconnection issue
content:
Hello All,

On my Laptop I run Firefox and Ivanti VPN for Customer stuff.

I configured Firefox to use the Windows Network (so proxy) configuration.

When i start the Laptop, so no VPN enabled, and open Firefox. all good and fine.

I enable VPN, Firefox does not load any page, other Browser do. My manual workaround is now, to open the Firefox cofniguration, goto the Proxy settings. Then disable Proxy config, close the Proxy config, go back in and select System defaults. I found online, that this is an old bug and my co worker do not encounter this.

My Firefox has version 119.0.1 (64-Bit)

Thank you in advance.
creator: jan_jan_jan_jan_jan

title: Does the recent list mean Firefox saved the PDF within the browser? Is it unsafe?
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm new to Firefox, I have been looking for the answer for a while but did not seem to find it.

Firefox is set by default to open PDF files, and I just noticed when right clicking the icon, it shows the recent list of documents that were opened before. My question would be whether it means that the PDF is somewhat saved within Firefox (as well as on the computer), and from a security perspective, could potentially visiting an unsafe website or cookies stored be able to access and compromise the documents previously viewed that are in the browser's 'recent' list? The same question would be for uBlock Origin which is running as an adblocker, is there a safety concern with that when opening PDFs through FF?

Many thanks in advance!
creator: Partibgf

title: The "Open previous windows and tabs" setting is off, but in effect
content:
Hello! Since updating to the last version (119.0.1), Firefox started keeping my open tabs between sessions. This is a behavior I don't want, and the only solution that I found told me to enable "clear history on close", however that is also not ideal, because I don't want to clear my history. The "Open previous windows and tabs" setting is off and my homepage is set to Firefox Default. I don't know where else to look for such a setting, except in the about:config, but even there I'm not sure which one is causing the issue. Any assistance would be appreciated.

Windows 10 Pro 21H2, Firefox 119.0.1
creator: honigkuchen

title: Firefox changed and all windows, tabs and settings disappeared: how to restore lost session?
content:
I restarted my computer and when I booted Firefox up it looked completely different. I'm assuming they updated, but updates never impacted my settings before and in this case none of my sessions or history is left.

I logged in to my Mozilla account and that recovered my extensions, though not my toolbar settings.

The real issue is that all of my tabs and windows are gone. In History, "Recently closed windows" is greyed out and Recently closed tabs shows nothing but what's been opened since I restarted.

Is there any way to recover my history?

Would reverting to an older version of the browser help? I'm not happy with this change at all.

title: When FF "Manage Bookmarks" Is Called From Private Window Can't See Buttons/Menus/Options (Linux)
content:
Wanted to export some bookmarks, and couldn't figure out why (latest Firefox) Bookmarks "Library" was missing relevant buttons/menus. (Screenshots attached.)

After testing, found they actually are there, but have have almost no contrast vs background - that is when "Manage Bookmarks" is called from a Private window. But things look fine when called from a Standard window. (No extensions; same in Safe Mode.)

Can anyone advise?

A simple workaround is to bring a standard window to the front first, but am curious if this is Firefox on all systems? Only FF Linux? Only the particular (default) settings of my Linux Mint 20.3 Cinnamon installation, and display? Not even sure a Bookmark management window is ever meant to assume the theme of the foreground window (here Private browsing's dark).

Thank you.
creator: crickt21

title: DNS setting issue with particular website
content:
As described in this thread (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1431159#answer-1618832), I had a problem accessing one particular domain after doing everything I could find to fix it. Setting DNS to Increased Protection fixed it. It's partly just curiosity but also concern that I'm asking if there is an issue that should be addressed.

The basic scenario: could not access one particular domain only in FF on one computer. No problems with FF on other devices and no problem with other browsers on the computer in question. Configuring DNS settings to Increased Protection is the only thing that allowed me to access that site (which happens to be the org I work for). So the setting is only necessary on this device and only for that domain.

What's the explanation or solution for ensuring I don't have other DNS issues, or something else, that will be a problem later?
creator: lifespan
